your video bitrate is too low for any discernible quality improvement over 720p. keep in mind that 1080p has more than twice as many pixels as 720p.  

i personally wouldn't go below 2200 Kbps for 1080p. also minimum bitrate for 48kHz stereo AAC should be 128 Kbps.

so which looks better?

anoxmous 1080p @ 1697Kbps:
http://i.imgur.com/hMp53.jpg

kingdom 720p @ 1976Kbps:
http://i.imgur.com/EKoVL.jpg

1080p resolution is meaningless if you don't have adequate bitrate.  granted, kingdom's file is 400MB larger (mostly due to higher bitrate for 6-channel audio), but i'll take kingdom's sharp 720p with surround sound over anoXmous' blurry 1080p with tinny crackly audio any day.
